A clearinghouse for media, petitions, and other events related to organizing against injustice at Indiana University Bloomington.

IUB Organizing Hub

Attacking Dr. Caitlin Barnard

Following the US Supreme Court’s Striking down of Roe v. Wade, Dr. Caitlin Barnard is harassed by the AG for providing an abortion to a 10 year old, sparking a national controversy.

Actions

  • IUPUI Faculty Council Resolution Supporting Reproductive Health Care
  • IU Faculty Letter regarding GR-01

Articles

  • Faculty Presidents Reprimanded by IU General Counsel for speaking out on Abortion Law [Medium]
  • Faculty presidents sent an email expressing concern about the state’s new abortion law. IU told them they had violated policy. [Medium]

  • An Indiana Doctor Speaks Out on Abortion, and Pays a Price [New York Times]

  • IU president Whitten’s defense of Dr. Bernard gets mixed reception  [WFIU]
  • Indiana doctor sues AG to block him from obtaining patient abortion records [NPR/WFIU]
  • IU Bloomington chapter of American Association of University Professors deplores Rokita’s attacks on Bernard [WFIU]
  • Indiana reprimands doctor who spoke publicly about providing 10-year-old’s abortion [NPR/WFIU]
  • An Indiana doctor spoke up about a 10-year-old’s abortion. Here’s what happened since [IndyStar]
  • Indiana abortion doctor: Caitlin Bernard fined for speaking about 10-year-old [BBC]
  • Indiana high court reprimands AG Rokita for remarks about 10-year-old rape victim’s doctor [BBC]

iub-organizing-collective

This site acts as a hub for news, media, petitions, and events around injustice on the campus of Indiana University Bloomington (IUB). This site is collectively managed by the Indiana University Bloomington Organizing Collective (IUB-OC), a loosely affiliated group composed of faculty, graduate students, undergraduates, and alumni from IUB.
